Drop the first header line and last four footnote lines so that only data rows remain.
Use the first remaining row as the real header, strip whitespace from each column name, then remove that row from the data.
Within each state, convert the `# of Reports` column from comma-separated strings to integers.
For every state group, sort its rows in descending order of `# of Reports` to identify the category with the highest count.
If the top category for that state equals `'Identity Theft'`, append the state name to a collection.
After iterating through all states, sort the collected state names alphabetically and print the final list.
